intro: Hemitelia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are ovate and have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Hemitelia mexicana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
